posts.name: jupitersutaishang
Fletch
posts.cooked:
When asking for coding help, it’s almost always necessary to share your code.  Youve shared some of it, which is good, but sharing the whole project would be better.  Ideally using a source control service such as github.com .

It’s also helpful to share the full error message (and any associated info, such as a stacktrace).  For the error you shared, there is definitely more to it, and it’s useful information to have.

That said, you almost certainly shouldn’t be calling configureBindings() twice.

link_counts.title: GitHub · Build and ship software on a single, collaborative platform · GitHub

posts.name: Brad
posts.cooked:
How is  your drive method implemented?  Did you do your own or use DifferentialDrive.arcadeDrive or curvatureDrive?

DifferentialDrive requires you feed the watchdog.  so if you are controlling the motors with your own method and not calling feed() it will complain.

posts.name: Joe Ross
posts.cooked:
In your forward, backward, right, left, and stop methods, don’t call the motor controllers directly. Instead, call the appropriate DifferentialDrive method. The tankDrive method should be pretty much a drop in for what you’re doing in those methods.

I’d also suggest making the motor controllers private in the subsystem, so you aren’t accidentally calling them somewhere else and causing the problem.
